intro: Distichoselinum tenuifolium, commonly known as the slender-leafed strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
